snippet: The federal budget deficit widened in November, driven by higher spending in such areas as Social Security, Medicare and defense.
abstract: Treasury Dept reports federal budget deficit widened in November, rising to $64.6 billion, up 13.6 percent from 2014; higher spending on Social Security, Medicare and defense are listed as reasons.
lead_paragraph: The federal budget deficit widened in November, driven by higher spending in such areas as Social Security, Medicare and defense.

headline.print_headline: Federal Budget Deficit Widens, Driven by Baby Boomers
headline.main: Federal Budget Deficit Widens, Driven by Baby Boomers
